attributes.action: relax Heathrow security measures to favour motorcycle helmets
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Many riders who also travel by air cannot risk their helmet being lost or delayed and prefer to carry it on-board. This is akin to not checking-in your wallet and keys.

Damage caused to a checked-in helmet, due to inappropriate handling by "baggage throwers", may  be invisible - and unknown - until the helmet is called upon to protect the rider's head in an incident.

Manufacturers typically recommend owners transport their helmet in specially designed bags.

At Heathrow, due to increased security measures, such a helmet is currently considered your "one item" - if it happens to also fit the strict size restrictions.

Exemptions to the "one item only" rule already apply for musical instruments, child seats, pushchairs, walking aids and wheelchairs. Why not these vital, fragile, and MANDATORY pieces of safety equipment too?
